title: Utilizing Senior Companions to Enhance Dementia Care Services and Supports
description_brief: The inability of healthcare systems to effectively manage Alzheimer's disease and related dementias (ADRD) often results in families remaining unaware of important community-based, long-term services and supports (LTSS) that could help to mitigate the negative effects of cognitive impairment. This project will feature a collaboration between Lutheran Social Service of Minnesota and the University of Minnesota to evaluate a novel adaption of the volunteer Senior Companion Program (SCP) to: a) assist families better manage ADRD at home; b) identify and facilitate the use of LTSS; and c) improve engagement with primary care providers throughout the state of Minnesota. If successful, the PorchLight Project will offer a potentially efficient, wide-ranging service model for states and communities to implement for persons with ADRD and their caregiving families.
description_detailed:
This project will evaluate a novel adaption of the Senior Companion Program (SCP) administered by Lutheran Social Service of Minnesota to assist families better manage their relatives' Alzheimer's disease or related dementias (ADRDs); identify and facilitate use of community-based long-term services and supports (LTSS); and improve engagement with healthcare providers. This intervention, called the PorchLight Project has the following aims:

Specific Aim 1. Implement PorchLight Project for 25 persons with ADRD or memory concerns (collectively, persons with memory loss \[PWML\]) and/or their caregivers in one urban and rural region of Minnesota. A convergent parallel mixed methods design \[(QUAN+QUAL)--\>QUAL\] will be utilized to examine the feasibility, acceptability, and utility of PorchLight Project for 25 families and their SC-Ds (n = 20) over a 3-month period (i.e., Stage I of the NIH Stage Model).

Specific Aim 2. Refine PorchLight Project delivery and implementation for efficacy evaluation. Activities to support this aim will include assessment of R61 milestones and incorporation of R61 findings to refine the PorchLight Project prior to efficacy evaluation. Through stakeholder engagement with the Dementia Healthcare Research Advisory Group (DHR) as well as analysis of the various quantitative and qualitative data elements collected during this Phase, we will finalize and refine effective training approaches for PorchLight Project Senior Companions (SCs), identify and confirm stakeholder-centric measures, and enhance the overall implementation of the PorchLight Project to inform a subsequent R33 Phase.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Not applicable; as this was a single arm pilot study, all enrolled participants were assigned to the Porchlight Project group.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: From PMCID: PMC8127785/PMID: 34036120: "Regional program coordinators (RPCs) introduced the PorchLight Project to volunteers during SCP meetings and via telephone...Enrolled volunteers assisted RPCs in recruiting clients and caregivers by distributing flyers and permission to contact forms during their usual visits; RPCs and lead volunteers followed up via telephone as needed."

groups.title: PorchLight Project Intervention Group: Clients
groups.description: Clients in the intervention group received home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Volunteers
groups.description: PorchLight Project: Senior Companions (or other LSS-MN volunteers providing senior companionship services) who delivered the PorchLight Project completed online CARES® Dementia Care Specialist training modules, additional trainings delivered by the research team (1. overview of the PorchLight Project, 2. review of the National Consensus Guidelines on Palliative Care, 3. review of the list of guided questions, and 4. review of journaling approach and LTSS resources), and participated in unstructured monthly check-ins (discussions and case review as applicable) with the research team.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Caregivers
groups.description: If caregivers were available and/or lived with clients, caregivers also received home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

milestones.comment: Please note: volunteers did not complete 1-month surveys as did clients and caregivers; instead, the numbers entered here reflect the milestone "training completed"

dropWithdraws.type: Few clients had memory loss, thus only 5 of 15 volunteers were able to apply their training

baselineCharacteristicsModule.populationDescription: Note that 33 volunteers were enrolled, and 31 volunteers completed a baseline survey.

groups.title: PorchLight Project Intervention Group: Clients
groups.description:
Participants in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

PorchLight Project: Senior Companions (or other LSS-MN volunteers providing senior companionship services) who deliver the PorchLight Project will complete online CARES® Dementia Care Specialist training modules, additional trainings delivered by the research team (1. overview of the PorchLight Project, 2. review of the National Consensus Guidelines on Palliative Care, 3. review of the list of guided questions, and 4. review of journaling approach and LTSS resources), and participate in unstructured monthly check-ins (discussions and case review as applicable) with the research team.

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measures.title: Employment status: Currently working full- or part-time

outcomeMeasures.title: Utilization of LTSS by PWML and Caregivers
outcomeMeasures.description: Community-based service utilization of PWML and caregivers will be assessed by asking participants to identify (from a fixed list of options) fifteen different home and community-based services (HCBS).
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Analysis population is the same as those who were enrolled, completed a baseline survey, and remained in the study for the 3 month follow-up

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Clients
groups.description: Clients in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Caregivers
groups.description: If available/present, caregivers in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

outcomeMeasures.title: Quality of Primary Care Interactions
outcomeMeasures.description: A 3-item measure of quality of interaction during primary care provider encounters. The total mean of item-responses was calculated, with a minimum value of 1 and a maximum value of 4. The higher scores mean higher quality interactions.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: One participant was loss to follow-up; in addition, at 3 months, one participant indicated they did not attend a doctor's appointment with the care recipient and thus did not complete the subsequent 3-item measure.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Caregivers
groups.description: If available, caregivers in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Distress: Burden
outcomeMeasures.description: Caregiver distress will be ascertained with the 22-item Zarit Burden Interview. Scores were summed; the higher the score, the more burden perceived. Minimum score of 0, high score of 88.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: One caregiver was lost to follow-up at the 1- and 3-month intervals.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Caregivers
groups.description:
Participants in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

PorchLight Project: Senior Companions (or other LSS-MN volunteers providing senior companionship services) who deliver the PorchLight Project will complete online CARES® Dementia Care Specialist training modules, additional trainings delivered by the research team (1. overview of the PorchLight Project, 2. review of the National Consensus Guidelines on Palliative Care, 3. review of the list of guided questions, and 4. review of journaling approach and LTSS resources), and participate in unstructured monthly check-ins (discussions and case review as applicable) with the research team.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Distress: Depressive Symptoms
outcomeMeasures.description: Caregiver distress will be ascertained with the 20-item Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression scale. An average/mean, total score of item-responses was computed, with a minimum score of 1 and a high score of 4. The higher the score, the more depressive symptoms experienced.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: One caregiver was lost to follow up during the 3 month study period.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Caregivers
groups.description:
Participants in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

PorchLight Project: Senior Companions (or other LSS-MN volunteers providing senior companionship services) who deliver the PorchLight Project will complete online CARES® Dementia Care Specialist training modules, additional trainings delivered by the research team (1. overview of the PorchLight Project, 2. review of the National Consensus Guidelines on Palliative Care, 3. review of the list of guided questions, and 4. review of journaling approach and LTSS resources), and participate in unstructured monthly check-ins (discussions and case review as applicable) with the research team.

outcomeMeasures.title: PWML Well-being
outcomeMeasures.description: We will assess the PWML health related quality of life using the EQ-5D-5L Visual Analog Scale. The measure is single score of a minimum of 0 and maximum of 100. Higher scores indicate better health.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Two clients were lost to follow-up/did not have longitudinal data available over the 3-month study period.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Clients
groups.description:
Participants in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

PorchLight Project: Senior Companions (or other LSS-MN volunteers providing senior companionship services) who deliver the PorchLight Project will complete online CARES® Dementia Care Specialist training modules, additional trainings delivered by the research team (1. overview of the PorchLight Project, 2. review of the National Consensus Guidelines on Palliative Care, 3. review of the list of guided questions, and 4. review of journaling approach and LTSS resources), and participate in unstructured monthly check-ins (discussions and case review as applicable) with the research team.

outcomeMeasures.title: PWML Depression
outcomeMeasures.description: PWML Depression will be ascertained using the 15-item Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form. The scale score is summed, with a minimum score of 0 and a maximum of 15. The higher the score, the greater the depressive symptoms experienced/indicated.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Two clients were lost to follow-up during the 3-month study period.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Clients
groups.description:
Participants in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

PorchLight Project: Senior Companions (or other LSS-MN volunteers providing senior companionship services) who deliver the PorchLight Project will complete online CARES® Dementia Care Specialist training modules, additional trainings delivered by the research team (1. overview of the PorchLight Project, 2. review of the National Consensus Guidelines on Palliative Care, 3. review of the list of guided questions, and 4. review of journaling approach and LTSS resources), and participate in unstructured monthly check-ins (discussions and case review as applicable) with the research team.

outcomeMeasures.title: PWML Quality of Life
outcomeMeasures.description: PWML Quality of Life will be ascertained using the 13-item Quality of Life Alzheimer's Disease-Measure (QOL-AD). The measure score is summed. The minimum score is 13 and the maximum score is 52. The higher the score, the greater perceived quality of life.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Two clients were lost to follow-up during the study period.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Clients
groups.description:
Participants in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

PorchLight Project: Senior Companions (or other LSS-MN volunteers providing senior companionship services) who deliver the PorchLight Project will complete online CARES® Dementia Care Specialist training modules, additional trainings delivered by the research team (1. overview of the PorchLight Project, 2. review of the National Consensus Guidelines on Palliative Care, 3. review of the list of guided questions, and 4. review of journaling approach and LTSS resources), and participate in unstructured monthly check-ins (discussions and case review as applicable) with the research team.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Self-efficacy
outcomeMeasures.description: An 8-item measure of caregiver self-efficacy developed by Fortinsky et al. (2002). The score is summed; the higher the score, the more self-efficacy the caregiver perceives. The minimum score on the scale is 8, the maximum is 40.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: One caregiver was lost to follow-up over the 3-month study period.

groups.title: Porchlight Project Intervention Group: Caregivers
groups.description:
Participants in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

PorchLight Project: Senior Companions (or other LSS-MN volunteers providing senior companionship services) who deliver the PorchLight Project will complete online CARES® Dementia Care Specialist training modules, additional trainings delivered by the research team (1. overview of the PorchLight Project, 2. review of the National Consensus Guidelines on Palliative Care, 3. review of the list of guided questions, and 4. review of journaling approach and LTSS resources), and participate in unstructured monthly check-ins (discussions and case review as applicable) with the research team.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Client: about 4 months; Caregiver: about 4 months; Volunteer: up to about 16 months (consent through end of funding period)
adverseEventsModule.description: No adverse events were suspected to be caused by study intervention/procedures.

eventGroups.title: Experimental: PorchLight Project Intervention Group: Volunteers
eventGroups.description: Volunteers enrolled undergo the PorchLight project intervention training.

eventGroups.title: Experimental: PorchLight Project Intervention Group: Clients
eventGroups.description: Participants in the intervention group will receive home-based support and respite services from PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteers of the Lutheran Social Services of Minnesota.

eventGroups.title: Experimental: PorchLight Project Intervention Group: Caregivers
eventGroups.description: Caregivers enrolled provide care to a client in the study that receives home-based support and respite services from a PorchLight Project trained Senior Companion volunteer.

limitationsAndCaveats.description: From PMCID: PMC8127785/PMID: 34036120: "...initial recruitment challenges as well as the COVID-19 pandemic severely curtailed our enrollment of clients and caregivers...Volunteer recruitment was successful (n = 33), and the largest barrier to training completion was early termination related to the pandemic...Due to slower training progress in the rural region, we did not enroll any rural clients or caregivers."

explanation_target: Reason: The description and trial title describe a behavioral/service intervention — an adaptation of the volunteer Senior Companion Program (PorchLight) to help families manage ADRD, connect to long‑term services and supports (LTSS), and improve primary care engagement. This is a non‑pharmacologic, care‑delivery/support program rather than a drug or biologic. citeturn0search5turn0search2

Act: Key extracted details — intervention name: PorchLight (utilizing Senior Companions); collaborators/sponsors: University of Minnesota and Lutheran Social Service of Minnesota; study type: embedded pragmatic trial following an R61 pilot; intervention class: training/volunteer service delivery to improve support and care coordination for persons with ADRD and their caregivers. citeturn0search4turn0search8

Reflect: Classification justification — the trial does not test a drug, biologic, or a pharmacologic cognitive or neuropsychiatric treatment. It evaluates a volunteer-based service model (training and deployment of Senior Companions), so it does not fit any of the four therapeutic categories (1–4) and is therefore classified as 'N/A'. Key supporting sources: University of Minnesota trial listings and Lutheran Social Service program pages. citeturn0search5turn0search0
